message: It's nowhere near as robust as Grooveshark, but it's fast and streamlined. Let me know what you guys think!
It's fast and it has the music I like. Good job!
Basically it's "Grooveshark Lite". You can search, download and listen to songs online for free. You can also create and share playlists. http://tunefort.com
I prefer your simplistic UI over the shark's.
Nicely done! I like your interface.
I have a partially complete API for music on Archive.org, if you wanted to include that music as well I could finish it up for you.
Took me a minute to realize that flash block was stopping songs from playing.  Not sure if there is an elegant solution to that or if enough people use flash block to even bother.
Great job! loving it.
this is real nice for a weekend project
however, licensing questions aside, i do like the simple interface. great work for a weekend project.
@izadcmuda i'm wondering how you deal with licensing infringement issues if you're putting these up on 4shared.com and offering it free to download...
@izadcmuda i have the same question as @akuril -- care to expand on the licensing?
Quick test of convore here for some clients :)
how many music do you have currently in your db?
Simple and straight forward, plus it works!  Very nice - two thumbs up!
@plinx0r @akuril To tell you the truth, I'm not really sure about the legality of this thing. All songs are uploaded by 4shared users to be downloaded by everyone
Check out 4shared APi here: http://help.4shared.com/index.php/SOAP_API
@jonathande4 Exactly. Although I don't think 4shared is going down anytime soon. It's one of the big filesharing sites available today. It's pretty big here in Asia.
@Dino What kind of API it is? Sounds interesting. Care to expand more?
I'm assuming that all licensing is handled through 4shared, so if 4shared is forced to remove all of its music, then you lose your database?
well, they are DMCA - http://www.4shared.com/terms.jsp - hate to be the buzzkill here, but it means that every illegal file reported will be removed from the server...
My app is kinda like a simple web *interface* for 4shared's massive database of songs, movies, games etc.
4shared is the only filesharing site that has an API. It's pretty fun to develop using it.
if you really don't see any problems with that.. then congrats on the project... it's very well made :)
@unwrangle Yup, exactly. That's why reported files won't show up in the search result.

tunefort is a clearly illegal site, so you should probably shut it down before you have some huge lawsuit or change it, i mean you can do something with non-copyrighted music, the code is good, but the sources for the file aren't
@izadcmuda nonetheless, I like your app...
remind me of the early days of songza, where they managed to pull songs using youtube... of course they don't do that anymore...
4shared has been around since at least 2006; not sure how, they clearly are hosting a lot of content they don't own.  Tunefort UI is really good though, reminds me of Amarok for KDE

I'm using Firefox on Ubuntu and after I search from a song I am unable to play it without adding to my playlist first. Is it how this works right now? I'd also suggest that # doesn't get appended to the URL in the address bar when I click on anything. That'd be nice. Nonetheless, I like your app and the simplistic UI :)
clean and simple first-run experience
